entry.title: Farmers in Qatar combat climate change with sustainable farming

media:group.media:title: Farmers in Qatar combat climate change with sustainable farming
media:group.media:description:
Farmers in Qatar are changing their ways to adapt to climate change. Many are turning to alternative methods to make food production more sustainable and encouraging others to do the same. Al Jazeera's Jillian Wolf reports from Al-Shahaniya, Qatar.

entry.title: US steps up plan to expel Haitian migrants from Texas border city

media:group.media:title: US steps up plan to expel Haitian migrants from Texas border city
media:group.media:description:
Thousands of undocumented Haitian migrants who crossed into the United States are to be deported. An estimated 13,000 people are staying at a makeshift camp in the Texas border town of Del Rio. Al Jazeera's John Holman reports from Acuna, Mexico.

entry.title: Last two escaped Palestinian prisoners surrender to Israel forces

media:group.media:title: Last two escaped Palestinian prisoners surrender to Israel forces
media:group.media:description:
Israel says it has captured the last two Palestinian prisoners who escaped from a maximum-security prison more than 10 days ago. The jailbreak embarrassed Israel’s security establishment but delighted Palestinians who see members of armed groups jailed by Israel as heroes in the struggle for statehood in the West Bank, Gaza and East Jerusalem, territory Israel captured in the 1967 Middle East war.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #Palestine #Israel #PalestinianPrisoners

entry.title: Cambodia dam row: Villagers say they are struggling to survive

media:group.media:title: Cambodia dam row: Villagers say they are struggling to survive
media:group.media:description:
Villagers in Cambodia are struggling to survive years after being displaced by the construction of the country’s largest dam. The Lower Se San 2 Dam was opened in 2018, and Human Rights Watch says it washed away the livelihoods of communities. Al Jazeera's Florence Looi reports.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #Cambodia #DamRow

entry.title: Space tourists come back to Earth after three days in orbit

media:group.media:title: Space tourists come back to Earth after three days in orbit
media:group.media:description:
The first all-civilian space flight has splashed down off the Florida coast. The SpaceX craft spent three days in orbit, carrying a billionaire entrepreneur and his three guests. Alexi O'Brien reports.

entry.title: Libya builds new infrastructure after decade-long conflict

media:group.media:title: Libya builds new infrastructure after decade-long conflict
media:group.media:description:
Government authorities in Libya are working on changing the image of the capital Tripoli as one of the most beautiful cities along the Mediterranean Sea. The interim government is building new parks and recreational areas for residents traumatised by 10 years of conflict. Al Jazeera's Malik Traina reports from Tripoli, Libya.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #Libya #Infrastructure

entry.title: CELAC meet in Mexico to challenge US dominance

media:group.media:title: CELAC meet in Mexico to challenge US dominance
media:group.media:description:
Mexico's president has called for a regional economic community similar to the European Union. He proposed the summit of Latin American and Caribbean states, which is taking place in his country. Al Jazeera's Manuel Rapalo reports from Mexico City.

entry.title: Tunisians protest over President Saied’s seizure of powers

media:group.media:title: Tunisians protest over President Saied’s seizure of powers
media:group.media:description:
Thousands of people have protested in the Tunisian capital for the first time since July when President Kais Saied seized governing powers and dismissed Parliament. He is now indicated that he plans to amend the constitution. Opponents are calling Saied's move an organised coup.
Al Jazeera's Dorsa Jabbari has more.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#AlJazeeraEnglish #Tunisia #Protest

entry.title: France accuses Australia, US of ‘lying’ over submarine deal

media:group.media:title: France accuses Australia, US of ‘lying’ over submarine deal
media:group.media:description:
France has accused Australia of a breach of trust after it scrapped a submarine contract and made a deal with the United States instead. Under the agreement, Australia will be able to acquire nuclear-powered submarines built with US and British technology. But it comes at the expense of France, which has lost a multibillion-dollar agreement to sell its submarines. Al Jazeera's Rory Challands reports from London, UK.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #France #Australia #UnitedStates #SubmarineDeal

entry.title: US admits it killed civilians in Kabul drone attack

media:group.media:title: US admits it killed civilians in Kabul drone attack
media:group.media:description:
The survivors of a US drone attack in Kabul are demanding compensation and to be relocated from Afghanistan. It comes after the US admitted that the attack, which was intended to target ISIL (ISIS), in fact killed 10 members of the same family.
Al Jazeera's Osama bin Javaid reports from Kabul, Afghanistan.
- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera - Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/
#AlJazeeraEnglish #Afghanistan #UnitedStates

entry.title: US braces for #JusticeforJ6 rallies supporting pro-Trump rioters

media:group.media:title: US braces for #JusticeforJ6 rallies supporting pro-Trump rioters
media:group.media:description:
There has been a heavy police presence in Washington, DC, for a rally supporting people arrested during the storming of the Capitol in January. Police are taking no chances fearing a repeat of the January 6 riot, and said their intelligence had reported "some threats of violence". Al Jazeera's Phil Lavelle reports from Washington, DC.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #UnitedStates #JusticeforJ6

entry.title: ICC to open investigation into Duterte’s “war on drugs” | Newsfeed

media:group.media:title: ICC to open investigation into Duterte’s “war on drugs” | Newsfeed
media:group.media:description:
The ICC has authorised a full investigation into alleged crimes against humanity during Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte’s “war on drugs”. Government officials say Duterte will not cooperate.
#Duterte #WaronDrugs #Philippines

media:group.media:description:
U.S military admits a drone strike in Kabul on August killed 10 civilians including children

entry.title: Will sanctions threat end the conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray? | Inside Story

media:group.media:title: Will sanctions threat end the conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray? | Inside Story
media:group.media:description:
U.S. president Joe Biden is adding pressure on all sides to end the fighting in Ethiopia's Tigray region. He's signed an executive order threatening new sanctions against the Ethiopian and Eritrean governments, leaders of Ethiopia's Amhara region, and the Tigray People's Liberation Front. While Tigrayan rebels welcomed the announcement, Ethiopia's Prime Minister accused the West of chastising his government. So will the U.S. threat be enough to stop nearly a year of fighting?
Presenter: Imran Khan
Guests: Zelalem Moges - Ethiopian international lawyer
William Davison - Ethiopia Senior Analyst, International Crisis Group
David Shinn - Former U.S. Ambassador to Ethiopia
#TigrayConflict #Ethiopia #USSanctions #AljazeeraEnglish

entry.title: Shining Path founder Abimael Guzman’s remains to be cremated

media:group.media:title: Shining Path founder Abimael Guzman’s remains to be cremated
media:group.media:description:
The remains of the man who founded one of Latin America's most violent rebel groups - the Shining Path - will be cremated. Peru's Congress reached the decision after days of heated debate over concerns that Abimael Guzman's gravesite could become a rallying point for supporters.
Al Jazeera’s Mariana Sanchez reports from Lima.
